{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3162947,"name":"Kmonteith","username":"Kmonteith","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/b5ac83/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-12T21:17:26.440Z","cooked":"

We have been having a large amount of our spark maxes burnout over the past two years. We thought it was just us but we started talking to other teams and have heard similar issues. The spark Max’s don’t output any power to motors but they have no errors or faults. We can’t keep going through $80 motor controllers. We have all the correct settings, have check all our connections and wiring. Is this a rev issue or am I missing something? We can’t keep having issues like this.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-03-12T21:17:26.440Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":412,"reads":190,"readers_count":189,"score":2098.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":429973,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-issues","display_username":"Kmonteith","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23621,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Head Coach/Software Engineer"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-issues/429973/1","custom_user_title":"Head Coach/Software Engineer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3162955,"name":"Mert Ata BABER","username":"BABER","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/baber/{size}/173331_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-12T21:27:34.102Z","cooked":"

We had the same problem. Not sure if same malfunction caused your sparks to die but in for our situation Rev said they were likely dead because of their age(1 year old).

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-03-12T21:46:37.103Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":189,"readers_count":188,"score":57.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":429973,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-issues","display_username":"Mert Ata BABER","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":4,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52778,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-issues/429973/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3162956,"name":"2582","username":"chadr03","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadr03/{size}/195529_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-12T21:29:07.454Z","cooked":"

You are going to have to be more specific on what your issue is.

We have used spark maxes for the past 3 seasons ~ 10-16 or so per robot. So like 40 or so motor controllers. We have had 1-2 issues with Spark maxes that we could not explain and rev sent us an at least one new one on RMA after going through support. We have killed a few more with poor placement causing mechanical damage and one we had in a situation that would backdrive from another system that caused a few failures. Overall have been very happy with the spark maxes. While not bullet proof they are pretty good. If you are having multiple failures there is likely an explainable reason.

I remember the days of the old Jaguar and I’d you looked at them funny they would let the magic smoke out.

The sparkmaxs that have died, get slower and slower and then stop outputting any power to the neos. We’ve tried in multiple positions, check wiring multiple times and still get the same problem. The neos are showing no faults or errors.

Are $80 spark maxes only suppose to last a year? That seems crazy considering the price. Our talons and Victors lasted for years.

Are any faults being reported by the SPARK MAXes you are using?

Have you walked through their troubleshooting guide to isolate the issue?

The issues you are describing can occur where either a motor fails or a specific part is damaged (like the encoder cable from the motor to the SPARK MAX).

I’m curious if any of these are still available and might help diagnose your issues.

Brushless Motor Controller Tester Control System
Schematic for sure! I’m hoping to pass this project on to @Ryan_Dognaux or @Greg_Needel to distribute it. If there are folks interested in buying some of batch 1, PM me. Looks like $40 will defray costs and flat rate shipping. BTW, for those folks using Wagos, I could set one of these up with Wagos in and out too. Might even be able to strap them onto the board Warn me if that’s what you want! Here’s a motor running happily! Note that the LEDs are pairs of red and green. For some…

@Weldingrod1

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-03-12T22:12:43.752Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":137,"readers_count":136,"score":52.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":429973,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-issues","display_username":"2582","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/brushless-motor-controller-tester/392593/38","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Brushless Motor Controller Tester","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13827,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-issues/429973/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3162997,"name":"dyanoshak","username":"dyanoshak","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dyanoshak/{size}/65422_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-12T22:30:39.262Z","cooked":"
BABER:

Rev said they were likely dead because of their age(1 year old).

I believe this was an miscommunication on our part.

Our support team was covering many things within the support ticket, including our warranty period, damage over time during a season, etc. It was an unfortunate misspeak to say they were not functional purely due to age. We intended to communicate there was likely damage due to extended overload over time.

Kmonteith:

Are $80 spark maxes only suppose to last a year? That seems crazy considering the price. Our talons and Victors lasted for years.

SPARK MAXs are designed to last many seasons when operated within their ratings. There are MAXs out in the wild that are still operating since their first FRC 2019 season.

Please reach out to support@revrobotics.com if you haven’t already. Without being in the shop with you, it is hard to diagnose issues that present themselves over long periods of time. However, there may be something that we will notice.

I called up before and they couldn’t connect us with electrical engineers for that week. The support I talked to couldn’t diagnose the problem. I will email, but is this something being worked on or being warned to teams or can we get them rma’d?

We will look out for your email. It is easier to keep all pieces of information together for the engineering team when in our email system. Thank you in advance for your patience as we gather information from you that you may have already mentioned over the phone.

Chadr03, I’m on the road for quite a while… I think I’ve sent them all out, except for the one with my team and the testing version I want to keep on hand.

I need to re-spin the board to capture some learning and make another batch. I’ve also come up with a way to make it show two or three levels of current, but that needs a bit more testing to finalize. @Ryan_Dognaux and @dyanoshak, any interest in stocking/handling these testers going forward? Or taking over the whole thing?
